body.p:
BIENNIAL REPORT
OF THE
SECRETARY OF STATE
OF THE
STATE OF NEBRASKA
FOR THE TWO YEARS ENDIN6 NOVEMBER 30, 1902
TO THE GOVERNOR
LINCOLN, NEB.
JACOB NORTH & CO., PRINTERS
1902
•
Office of Secretary of State,
Lincoln, Neb., November 30, 1902.
To His Excellency, Ezra P. Savage, Governor of the State of
Sib — I have the honor to transmit herewith a report of this department for the two years ending November 30, 1902. The report as presented will be found to contain the business transactions of this office, together with a summary of the business transacted by the various boards of which I am a member. This report contains the appropriations for and the expenditures of this office, also a list of the corporations filing articles during the past biennium. I have omitted from this report the list of municipal and school bonds approved by me for the reason that the same appears in the report of the Auditor of Public Accounts. I have also omitted the certificates of approval of banks by the State Banking Board for the reason that the same appears in the report of the Banking Department ; the list of notaries public commissioned has also been omitted. In making up this report I have endeavored to include only such matters as pertain to this office alone, omitting such items as have usually been found in this report, but which can be found in the reports of other departments, or which are not of any especial benefit to the public.
Respectfully submitted,
Geo. W. Marsh,
Secretary of State.

REPORT OF THE
BOARDS
The Secretary of State, by virtue of his office, is a meml>er of the following boards:
Board of Public Lands and Buildings.
Board of Educational Lands and Funds.
Board of Purchase and Supplies.
Printing Board.
Board of Pharmacy.
Board of Canvassers.
Board to approve Depository Bonds.
Board of Prison Inspectors.
I The transactions of the Board of Public Lands and Build's of which the Secretary of State is the secretary will be )r£ fully set forth in this volume.
The report of the Board of Educational Lands and Funds will be found in the report of the Commissioner of Public Lands and Buildings, which will also contain the transactions of the Board of Purchase and Supplies.
I The Secretary of State is president of the Printing Board,, d an itemized statement of its business will be found elselere in this report.
The Board of Canvassers have canvassed the vote for Justice of the Supreme Court, Regents of the State University, and Judge of the District Court in the 11th Judicial District in the election of 1901. Also the vote on the proposed amendment to the Constitution of the State of Nebraska, relative to the manner of submitting amendments to the Constitution of the State of Nebraska, and Judges of the District Court in the Fourth Judicial District in the election of 1902.
The actions of the Board to approve depository bonds will be found in the report of the Auditor of Public Accounts.
The report of the Board of Prison Inspectors will be included in the report of the Warden of the State Penitentiary.
11
